meanings.definition: The state or condition of being born.
meanings.sent1: The natality of the baby brought joy to the family.
meanings.sent2: The natality of new life is a beautiful thing to witness.
meanings.sent3: The natality of the puppies was a delightful surprise for the dog owners.
meanings.sent4: In the garden, the natality of flowers in spring is like a colorful explosion.
meanings.sent5: The natality of ducklings following their mother is a heartwarming sight.

meanings.definition: The rate of birth in a population.
meanings.sent1: The natality in the village has been steadily increasing over the years.
meanings.sent2: Experts study the natality of different regions to understand population growth.
meanings.sent3: The natality in the zoo seemed to be at an all-time high with so many new arrivals.
meanings.sent4: The natality of ideas in a creative community is like a fountain of inspiration.
meanings.sent5: The natality of fish in the river during spawning season is a remarkable phenomenon.
